column1: Oligoclonal bands are proteins called immunoglobulins.
They include: - Cisternal puncture - Ventricular puncture - Removal of CSF from a tube that is already in the CSF, such as a shunt or ventricular drain.
Oligoclonal bands in the CSF can also be seen in other illnesses.
There are two or more bandings found in the CSF and not in the blood.
